intro: Dendropanax umbellatus, commonly known as the umbrella-leaf sedge, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like arrangement of leaves. The plant typically grows in wet, shaded environments such as swamps and stream banks. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, giving it its common name. Dendropanax umbellatus is an important component of New Zealand's freshwater ecosystems.
